security: This document contains sensitive compartmented information and refers to specific intelligence products and operations (e.g., "3/0/TRIG-CUI/T23-62"). Disclosing these details could reveal intelligence sources, methods, and targets, potentially compromising ongoing or future operations. The document is marked TOP SECRET UMBRA, further emphasizing its highly sensitive nature.
summary: A 1976 NSA memorandum details a meeting between NSA's John C. Wobensmith and SSCI staffers Tom Moore and Howard Liebengood, during which an NSA product on Antonio Veciana was reviewed, leading to the SSCI requesting a review of all Cuban material from 1961-1965.
summary_one_paragraph: On December 30, 1976, John C. Wobensmith of the NSA documented a meeting with Senate Select Committee on Intelligence (SSCI) staffers Tom Moore and Howard Liebengood to review an NSA product concerning Antonio Veciana, specifically message 3/0/TRIG-CUI/T23-62 dated November 29, 1962. The SSCI staffers expressed significant interest, particularly in a reference to "Serafin," and subsequently requested a comprehensive review of all Cuban material from the period of 1961 to 1965, as indicated in the memorandum and its enclosures.
title: SSCI Request for Product on Antonio Veciana
